cab.content: /^22one with the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government and should beOffices of the War Cabinet for transmission to the Colonial Officeunless required for official use.)TELEGRM from the Governor General of New zealand to the Secretary of State for the Colonies.(Received GolonialQffice 1.54 p.m., $th March, 1919) New Zealand wool. With reference to last paragraph of your telegram 8th February understand-ing of Government of New Zealand is that ImperialGovernment wili^purchase all wool clipped in theDominion; to the 30th June 1920 and all slipe woolproduced by freezing companies before the 30th June1920 and arrangements providing for this have beencompleted. Should circumstances arise atlater datehowever which will make it appear advisable that theperiod of purchase should be extended Government ofNew Zealand will appreciate an opportunity of opening further negotiations with Imperial government or on the other hand be glad to consider any further proposals Imperial Government may consider it adiisa-ble to submit.LIVERPOOL
